messages.subject: Re: how stuff is made
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/14/2000 1:59:37 PM Central Standard Time, brynlee@telus.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/14/2000 1:59:37 PM Central Standard Time,
brynlee@... writes:

<< I have seen the How Stuff Works site but I am wondering if anyone has seen
a site about how things are made. Eg. What is an eraser made of???
The girls would like answers to this and many other questions. >>
Hi,
I don't have a particular site in mind, but you can find lots of answers at
www.askjeeves.com.

On a similar topic, one of the things my boys enjoy most is to make a trip to
Goodwill or Salvation Army and spend a little money to get a box full of old
appliances. We then have a blast taking them apart, rebuilding them, and
combining parts to make new kinds of inventions. It's cheap fun!

pax et bonum,
KIM

messages.subject: how stuff is made
messages.msgSnippet: I have seen the How Stuff Works site but I am wondering if anyone has seen a site about how things are made. Eg. What is an eraser made of??? The girls would
messages.messageBody:
I have seen the How Stuff Works site but I am wondering if anyone has seen
a site about how things are made. Eg. What is an eraser made of???
The girls would like answers to this and many other questions.

Thanks for any help on this...
Brooke
brynlee@...
